briefdescription.para: Retrieves an entry's content from the quasardb server. The caller is responsible for allocating and freeing the provided buffer.

detaileddescription.para: If the entry does not exist, the function will fail and return qdb_e_alias_not_found.

If the buffer is not large enough to hold the data, the function will fail and return qdb_e_buffer_too_small. content_length will nevertheless be updated with entry size so that the caller may resize its buffer and try again.

parameterdescription.para: A valid handle previously initialized by qdb_open or qdb_open_tcp.
A pointer to a null-terminated UTF-8 string representing the alias of the entry.
A pointer to an user allocated buffer that will receive the entry's content.

A pointer to a qdb_size_t initialized with the length of the destination buffer, in bytes. It will be updated with the length of the retrieved content, even if the buffer is not large enough to hold all the data.

simplesect.para: A qdb_error_t code indicating success or failure.

memberdef.argsstring: (qdb_handle_t handle, const char *alias, const void **content, qdb_size_t *content_length)
memberdef.name: qdb_blob_get

briefdescription.para: Retrieves an entry's content from the quasardb server.

detaileddescription.para: If the entry does not exist, the function will fail and return qdb_e_alias_not_found.
The function will allocate a buffer large enough to hold the entry's content. This buffer must be released by the caller with a call to qdb_free_buffer().

If the buffer is not large enough to hold the data, the function will fail and return qdb_e_buffer_too_small. content_length will nevertheless be updated with entry size so that the caller may resize its buffer and try again.

parameterdescription.para: A valid handle previously initialized by qdb_open or qdb_open_tcp.
A pointer to a null-terminated UTF-8 string representing the alias of the entry.
A pointer to a pointer that will be set to a function-allocated buffer holding the entry's content.
A pointer to a qdb_size_t that will be set to the content's size, in bytes.

simplesect.para: A qdb_error_t code indicating success or failure.

memberdef.argsstring: (qdb_handle_t handle, const char *alias, const void **content, qdb_size_t *content_length)
memberdef.name: qdb_blob_get_and_remove

briefdescription.para: Atomically gets an entry from the quasardb server and removes it.

detaileddescription.para: If the entry does not exist, the function will fail and return qdb_e_alias_not_found.
The function will allocate a buffer large enough to hold the entry's content. This buffer must be released by the caller with a call to qdb_free_buffer().

If the buffer is not large enough to hold the data, the function will fail and return qdb_e_buffer_too_small. content_length will nevertheless be updated with entry size so that the caller may resize its buffer and try again.

parameterdescription.para: A valid handle previously initialized by qdb_open or qdb_open_tcp.
A pointer to a null-terminated UTF-8 string representing the alias of the entry.
A pointer to a pointer that will be set to a function-allocated buffer holding the entry's content.
A pointer to a qdb_size_t that will be set to the content's size, in bytes.

simplesect.para: A qdb_error_t code indicating success or failure.

memberdef.argsstring: (qdb_handle_t handle, const char *alias, const void *content, qdb_size_t content_length, qdb_time_t expiry_time)
memberdef.name: qdb_blob_put

briefdescription.para: Creates a new entry and sets its content to the provided blob.

detaileddescription.para: If the entry already exists the function will fail and will return qdb_e_alias_already_exists.
Keys beginning with the string "qdb" are reserved and cannot be added to the cluster.
You can specify an expiry or use qdb_never_expires if you don't want the entry to expire.
There is no arbitrary limit to the size of blobs. To operate on entries that do not fit in RAM, consider using streams.

parameterdescription.para: A valid handle previously initialized by qdb_open or qdb_open_tcp.
A pointer to a null-terminated UTF-8 string representing the alias of the entry.
A pointer to the buffer with the blob content
The length of the buffer, in bytes
An optional absolute expiry time expressed in UTC UNIX epoch.

simplesect.para: A qdb_error_t code indicating success or failure.

memberdef.argsstring: (qdb_handle_t handle, const char *alias, const void *content, qdb_size_t content_length, qdb_time_t expiry_time)
memberdef.name: qdb_blob_update

briefdescription.para: Creates or updates an entry and sets its content to the provided blob.

detaileddescription.para: If the entry already exists the function will create the entry.
Keys beginning with the string "qdb" are reserved and cannot be added to the cluster.
You can specify an expiry or use qdb_never_expires if you don't want the entry to expire.
There is no arbitrary limit to the size of blobs. To operate on entries that do not fit in RAM, consider using streams.

parameterdescription.para: A valid handle previously initialized by qdb_open or qdb_open_tcp.
A pointer to a null-terminated UTF-8 string representing the alias of the entry.
A pointer to the buffer with the blob content
The length of the buffer, in bytes
An optional absolute expiry time expressed in UTC UNIX epoch.

simplesect.para: A qdb_error_t code indicating success or failure.

memberdef.argsstring: (qdb_handle_t handle, const char *alias, const void *content, qdb_size_t content_length, qdb_size_t offset, int truncate, qdb_time_t expiry_time)
memberdef.name: qdb_reserved_blob_merge

briefdescription.para: This function is reserved for internal use and its usage is discouraged.

parameterdescription.para: A valid handle previously initialized by qdb_open or qdb_open_tcp.
A pointer to a null-terminated UTF-8 string representing the alias of the entry.
A pointer to the content to merge
The length of the buffer, in bytes
Offset at which merge content
1 the entry will be truncated at the end of the new buffer 0 the original content will be preserved
An optional absolute expiry time expressed in UTC UNIX epoch.

simplesect.para: A qdb_error_t code indicating success or failure.

memberdef.argsstring: (qdb_handle_t handle, const char *alias, const void *update_content, qdb_size_t update_content_length, qdb_time_t expiry_time, const void **get_content, qdb_size_t *get_content_length)
memberdef.name: qdb_blob_get_and_update

briefdescription.para: Atomically gets and updates (in this order) the entry on the quasardb server.

detaileddescription.para: The entry must already exist.

parameterdescription.para: A valid handle previously initialized by qdb_open or qdb_open_tcp.
A pointer to a null-terminated UTF-8 string representing the alias of the entry.
A pointer to the buffer with the new blob content
The length of the buffer, in bytes
An optional absolute expiry time expressed in UTC UNIX epoch.
A pointer to a pointer to an API-allocated buffer holding the entry content, before the update.
A pointer to a qdb_size_t that will be set to the content's size, in bytes.

simplesect.para: A qdb_error_t code indicating success or failure.

memberdef.argsstring: (qdb_handle_t handle, const char *alias, const void *new_value, qdb_size_t new_value_length, const void *comparand, qdb_size_t comparand_length, qdb_time_t expiry_time, const void **original_value, qdb_size_t *original_value_length)
memberdef.name: qdb_blob_compare_and_swap

briefdescription.para: Atomically compares the entry with comparand and updates it to new_value if, and only if, they match.

detaileddescription.para: The function returns the original value of the entry in case of a mismatch. When it matches, no content is returned.
The entry must already exist.
Update will occur if and only if the content of the entry matches bit for bit the content of the comparand buffer.

parameterdescription.para: A valid handle previously initialized by qdb_open or qdb_open_tcp.
A pointer to a null-terminated UTF-8 string representing the alias of the entry.
A pointer to a buffer that represents the entry's content to be updated to the server in case of match.
The length of the buffer, in bytes
A pointer to a buffer that represents the entry's content to be compared to.
The length of the buffer, in bytes
An optional absolute expiry time expressed in UTC UNIX epoch.
A pointer to a pointer that will be set to a function-allocated buffer holding the entry's original content, before the update, if any.
A pointer to a qdb_size_t that will be set to the content's size, in bytes.

simplesect.para: A qdb_error_t code indicating success or failure.

memberdef.argsstring: (qdb_handle_t handle, const char *alias, const void *comparand, qdb_size_t comparand_length)
memberdef.name: qdb_blob_remove_if

briefdescription.para: Atomically removes the entry on the server if the content matches.

detaileddescription.para: The entry must already exist.
Removal will occur if and only if the content of the entry matches bit for bit the content of the comparand buffer.

parameterdescription.para: A valid handle previously initialized by qdb_open or qdb_open_tcp.
A pointer to a null-terminated UTF-8 string representing the alias of the entry.
A pointer to a buffer to use a comparand
The length of the buffer, in bytes

simplesect.para: A qdb_error_t code indicating success or failure.

memberdef.argsstring: (qdb_handle_t handle, const void *pattern, qdb_size_t pattern_length, qdb_int_t max_count, const char ***aliases, size_t *alias_count)
memberdef.name: qdb_blob_scan

briefdescription.para: Retrieves all blobs that have content matching the specified pattern.

detaileddescription.para: This function is experimental. The complexity of this function is linear in the number of entries.

parameterdescription.para: A valid handle previously initialized by qdb_open or qdb_open_tcp.
A pointer to the pattern buffer to search for
The length of the pattern buffer, in bytes
An integer limiting the number of results returned by the function
A pointer to an array of null-terminated UTF-8 string that will list the aliases of the entries matching the requested pattern.
A pointer to an integer that will receive the number of returned aliases.

simplesect.para: A qdb_error_t code indicating success or failure.

memberdef.argsstring: (qdb_handle_t handle, const char *pattern, qdb_int_t max_count, const char ***aliases, size_t *alias_count)
memberdef.name: qdb_blob_scan_regex

briefdescription.para: Retrieves all blobs that have content matching the specified regular expression (regex)

detaileddescription.para: This function is experimental. The complexity of this function is linear in the number of entries.

parameterdescription.para: A valid handle previously initialized by qdb_open or qdb_open_tcp.
A pointer to a null-terminated UTF-8 string representing the regular expression to search for. The regex syntax is defined by ECMA-262 grammar.
An integer limiting the number of results returned by the function
A pointer to an array of null-terminated UTF-8 string that will list the aliases of the entries matching the requested pattern.
A pointer to an integer that will receive the number of returned aliases.

simplesect.para: A qdb_error_t code indicating success or failure.
